title: H05-1095

sentences.text: This paper presents a phrase-based statistical machine translation method , based on non-contiguous phrases , i.e. phrases with gaps .
A method for producing such phrases from a word-aligned corpora is proposed .

A statistical translation model is also presented that deals such phrases , as well as a training method based on the maximization of translation accuracy , as measured with the NIST evaluation metric .
Translations are produced by means of a beam-search decoder .
Experimental results are presented , that demonstrate how the proposed method allows to better generalize from the training data .

Entity-such_phrase.label: such phrases
Entity-such_phrase.description: Such phrases refer to non-contiguous phrases in statistical machine translation that include gaps, which are generated from word-aligned corpora for improved translation accuracy.

Entity-this_paper.label: This paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper refers to a research study that introduces a novel phrase-based statistical machine translation method utilizing non-contiguous phrases, along with techniques for phrase production, statistical modeling, and training aimed at enhancing translation accuracy.

Entity-phrase-based_statistical_machine_.label: phrase-based statistical machine translation method
Entity-phrase-based_statistical_machine_.description: A phrase-based statistical machine translation method is a computational approach to translating text that utilizes statistical models to analyze and generate translations based on phrases rather than individual words.

Entity-phrase.label: phrases
Entity-phrase.description: The term 'phrases' refers to linguistic units used in a phrase-based statistical machine translation method, specifically non-contiguous phrases that include gaps, which are generated from a word-aligned corpus.

Entity-gap.label: gaps
Entity-gap.description: In the context of this paper, 'gaps' refers to the non-contiguous elements within phrases used in a phrase-based statistical machine translation method.

Entity-method.label: method
Entity-method.description: The method refers to a technique for producing non-contiguous phrases from a word-aligned corpus in the context of phrase-based statistical machine translation.

Entity-producing_such_phrase_from_a_word.label: producing such phrases from a word-aligned corpora
aliases: producing such phrases from a word-aligned corpora
Entity-producing_such_phrase_from_a_word.description: The term 'producing such phrases from a word-aligned corpora' refers to the process of generating non-contiguous phrases with gaps for statistical machine translation by utilizing a corpus where words are aligned between source and target languages.

mentions.local_name: producing such phrases from a word-aligned corpora

Entity-non-contiguous_phrase.label: non-contiguous phrases
Entity-non-contiguous_phrase.description: Non-contiguous phrases refer to linguistic constructs used in phrase-based statistical machine translation that consist of phrases with gaps, allowing for more flexible translation modeling.

Entity-a_training_method.label: a training method
Entity-a_training_method.description: A training method that focuses on maximizing translation accuracy in a phrase-based statistical machine translation model, evaluated using the NIST metric.

Entity-statistical_translation_model.label: statistical translation model
Entity-statistical_translation_model.description: A statistical translation model is a computational framework used in natural language processing that employs statistical methods to translate text from one language to another by analyzing and modeling the relationships between source and target language phrases.

Entity-maximization_of_translation_accur.label: maximization of translation accuracy
Entity-maximization_of_translation_accur.description: The maximization of translation accuracy refers to a training method in statistical machine translation that aims to enhance the precision of translations, evaluated using the NIST metric.

Entity-translation.label: Translations
Entity-translation.description: Translations refer to the output generated by a beam-search decoder in the context of a phrase-based statistical machine translation method.

Entity-word-aligned_corpus.label: word-aligned corpora
Entity-word-aligned_corpus.description: Word-aligned corpora are linguistic resources that consist of parallel texts in different languages, where corresponding words or phrases are aligned to facilitate comparative linguistic analysis and machine translation.

Entity-beam-search_decoder.label: beam-search decoder
Entity-beam-search_decoder.description: A beam-search decoder is an algorithm used in natural language processing and machine learning for generating sequences by exploring multiple possible outputs and selecting the most likely candidates based on a defined scoring mechanism.

Entity-nist_evaluation_metric.label: NIST evaluation metric
Entity-nist_evaluation_metric.description: The NIST evaluation metric is a quantitative measure used to assess the quality of machine translation outputs by comparing them to reference translations.

Entity-translation_accuracy.label: translation accuracy
Entity-translation_accuracy.description: Translation accuracy is a metric used to evaluate the quality of translated text by measuring how closely the translation matches the intended meaning of the source text.

Entity-proposed_method.label: proposed method
Entity-proposed_method.description: The proposed method refers to a specific approach or technique designed to improve the generalization capabilities of a model based on training data.

Entity-training_method.label: training method
Entity-training_method.description: A training method is a systematic approach or technique used to enhance the performance or accuracy of a model or system through structured learning processes.

Entity-training_data.label: training data
Entity-training_data.description: Training data refers to a collection of data used to train a machine learning model, enabling it to learn patterns and make predictions.

Entity-experimental_result.label: Experimental results
Entity-experimental_result.description: Experimental results refer to the data and findings obtained from conducting experiments, which are used to evaluate the effectiveness or performance of a method or hypothesis.

Entity-nist.label: NIST
Entity-nist.description: NIST refers to the National Institute of Standards and Technology, a federal agency in the United States that develops and promotes measurement standards and technology.

summary: This paper presents a phrase-based statistical machine translation method , based on non-contiguous phrases , i.e. phrases with gaps . A method for producing such phrases from a word-aligned corpora is proposed . A statistical translation model is also presented that deals such phrases , as well as a training method based on the maximization of translation accuracy , as measured with the NIST evaluation metric . Translations are produced by means of a beam-search decoder . Experimental results are presented , that demonstrate how the proposed method allows to better generalize from the training data .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject is introducing, showcasing, or making known the object to an audience. It implies a formal or structured communication of information, findings, or concepts, where the subject serves as the source of the presentation and the object represents the content being conveyed.

Predicate-based_on.label: based on
Predicate-based_on.description: The predicate 'based on' establishes a foundational relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is derived from, influenced by, or constructed upon the principles, concepts, or elements represented by the object. It signifies that the subject's characteristics, functionality, or methodology are fundamentally linked to the object, suggesting that the object serves as a basis or reference point for the subject.

Predicate-i.e..label: i.e.
Predicate-i.e..description: The predicate 'i.e.' is used to clarify or specify the subject by providing an equivalent or restated expression in the object. It indicates that the object is a more precise or explanatory term that defines or elaborates on the subject.

Predicate-is_proposed_for_producing.label: is proposed for producing
Predicate-is_proposed_for_producing.description: The predicate 'is proposed for producing' indicates a suggestion or recommendation regarding the capability or intended use of the subject in relation to the object. It implies that the subject, which can be a method, technique, or approach, is being put forward as a means to generate, create, or yield the object, which typically represents a result, output, or product. This connection highlights the potential effectiveness or suitability of the subject in achieving the desired outcome represented by the object.

Predicate-produces.label: produces
Predicate-produces.description: The predicate 'produces' indicates a relationship where the subject is responsible for the creation, generation, or formation of the object. It implies that the subject has the capability or function to yield the object as a result of its operation or process.

Predicate-deals_with.label: deals with
Predicate-deals_with.description: The predicate 'deals with' indicates a relationship in which the subject is engaged in a process, activity, or subject matter that pertains to the object. It suggests that the subject has a focus or responsibility towards the object, often implying a level of interaction, management, or consideration of the object within the context of the subject's domain.

Predicate-is_measured_with.label: is measured with
Predicate-is_measured_with.description: The predicate 'is measured with' establishes a relationship between a subject and an object, indicating that the subject is evaluated or quantified using the method or tool represented by the object. This connection implies that the object serves as a standard or metric for assessing the performance, quality, or effectiveness of the subject in a specific context.

Predicate-produced_by_means_of.label: produced by means of
Predicate-produced_by_means_of.description: The predicate 'produced by means of' indicates a relationship where the subject is generated or created through the utilization of the object. It implies that the object serves as a method, tool, or process that facilitates the production of the subject, highlighting the dependency of the subject's existence or formation on the specified means.

Predicate-are_produced_by.label: are produced by
Predicate-are_produced_by.description: The predicate 'are produced by' indicates a relationship where the subject is the result or output of a process or action performed by the object. It signifies that the object is the agent or mechanism responsible for creating, generating, or manufacturing the subject.

Predicate-allows_to_better_generalize_fr.label: allows to better generalize from
Predicate-allows_to_better_generalize_fr.description: The predicate 'allows to better generalize from' indicates that the subject provides a mechanism or capability that enhances the ability to derive broader conclusions or insights from the object. In this context, it suggests that the subject facilitates improved understanding or application of the information contained in the object, leading to more effective or accurate outcomes in related scenarios.

Predicate-demonstrate_how.label: demonstrate how
Predicate-demonstrate_how.description: The predicate 'demonstrate how' serves to establish a relationship between the subject and the object by illustrating the mechanisms, processes, or methods through which the subject achieves a particular outcome or effect represented by the object. It implies a detailed explanation or exposition of the underlying principles or techniques that connect the two entities.

Predicate-demonstrate.label: demonstrate
Predicate-demonstrate.description: The predicate 'demonstrate' indicates a relationship where the subject provides evidence or proof of the validity, effectiveness, or existence of the object. In this context, the subject showcases or illustrates the characteristics or performance of the object, thereby establishing a connection that highlights the object's significance or functionality.

Predicate-introduces.label: introduces
Predicate-introduces.description: The predicate 'introduces' signifies an action where the subject presents, brings forth, or makes known the object to an audience or context. It implies a transfer of information or concepts, indicating that the subject is the source of the introduction and the object is the entity being presented or highlighted.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or concept that falls under the wider category or concept represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a broader scope or definition that includes the subject as a subset.
